result.execSummary:
The defendant Montonio Reed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees due on or before 4-2-16. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.

TIME SERVED 
MUST provide a DNA sample.
Upon proof the defendant has completed his GED/HSED, and provide proof to the court, the court will consider expungement.
Consecutive to: any other sentence with credit for 79 days time served
As a convicted felon defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Montonio Reed

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Statement made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:  COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 75 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 79 days TIME SERVED.

COURT ORDERED the following:
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees due on or before 04-02-2016. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  MUST provide a DNA sample.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons.

Upon proof the Defendant has completed his GED/HSED, and provide proof to the court, the Court will consider expungement.

Received and filed with the court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

Defendant Montonio Reed in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Montonio Reed in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2:  On motion of the State Court ordered Count 2 DISMISSED AND READ-IN.

Defendant Montonio Reed in court with attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea hearing scheduled for 04-02-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Montonio Reed in court with attorney Christian T. Eichenlaub.  Defendant Montonio Reed in custody.  Step Nolten for Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

ADDRESS INFO for Montonio Reed
Current: 2830 N 28TH ST, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 01-18-2014)
Prior: 5969 North 66th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218

Defendant Montonio Reed in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Montonio Reed in custody.  Michael C. Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
